event.title: purchased from John Haft on January 24, 1827

data.event: The land on which this town stands was part of a tract purchased from John Haft on January 24, 1827, by Daniel Houston, a near relative of Gen. Sam Houston, leader of the Texans in their war for independence from Mexico.

event.title: was completed through that section in 1871

data.event: After the Chartiers Valley Railroad was completed through that section in 1871, David C. Houston, a son of Daniel Houston, saw the possibilities of a town at that point and laid out the present plan of Houstonville.

event.title: was completed in the summer of 1871

data.event: The first house in the new town was completed in the summer of 1871 by A. T. Haft and the second by J. C. Johnson.

event.title: A few years later H. E. Riggle laid out

data.event: A few years later H. E. Riggle laid out a plan adjoining which was called Riggletown until the Borough of Houstonville was incorporated on May 13, 1901.
